title: How to Make Lemonade Ice Cream

steps.headline: Bring the milk to a boil.
steps.description: Once the milk has boiled, place a lid on the pot and set it aside. (Don’t let the milk cool to room temperature, though.)

steps.headline: Combine the egg yolks and the sugar.
steps.description: Use a whisk or an electric mixer and beat them until the mixture is thick and fluffy.

steps.headline: Gradually add the milk to the sugar mixture.
steps.description: Blend it together as you add it.

steps.headline: Heat on the stove at a low temperature.
steps.description: Stir the cream with a spoon continuously to avoid burning; it should become a bit thicker and cover the spoon. Avoid boiling the mixture. This will result in curdling.

steps.headline: Blend in the lemon extract, zest, and juice.
steps.description: Mix until fully combined and allow the cream to cool.

steps.headline: Chill the cream.
steps.description: Once the combination has reached room temperature, cover it with plastic wrap and place it in the fridge.

steps.headline: Use an ice cream maker to partly freeze the cream.
steps.description: If you don't have an ice cream maker, try using a bag - fill one bag with salt and ice, pour the cream into another bag and seal it, place the bagged cream into the bag of ice, seal the second bag, and shake it.

steps.headline: Mix in the lemonade concentrate as the cream starts freezing.
steps.description: Blend thoroughly, then continue to freeze the ice cream. The ice cream will not fully freeze; this is normal.

steps.headline: Put the ice cream in the freezer.
steps.description: Allow it to freeze until fully solid.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Scoop the ice cream into serving bowls. Garnish with whipped cream and lemon syrup, if desired. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Beat the whipping cream, condensed milk, and lemonade concentrate in a large bowl.
steps.description: Blend with an electric mixer until fully combined.

steps.headline: Add the food coloring, if desired.
steps.description: This will give it a more lemon-like final appearance. Add in the food coloring and blend until the mixture is one solid color, with no streaks.

steps.headline: Freeze the cream.
steps.description: Pour the cream mixture into a container and freeze it for 4-5 hours, or until the ice cream is solid.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Scoop the ice cream into serving bowls. Top with any desired toppings, such as whipped cream or sprinkles. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Combine the pudding mix and milk into a bowl.
steps.description: Whisk well until the consistency is creamy and smooth.

steps.headline: Chill the pudding in the fridge for five minutes.
steps.description: Leave the pudding in the fridge and remove once it sets.

steps.headline: Fold half of the whipped topping into the pudding.
steps.description: Only add four ounces of the frozen whipped topping. Blend with an electric mixer on a low setting. Mix well until well combined and smooth.

steps.headline: In a separate bowl, mix the remaining whipped topping with the pink lemonade packet.
steps.description: Stir well with a rubber spatula until fully incorporated.

steps.headline: Add the pink lemonade mixture into the pudding mixture.
steps.description: Drop spoonfuls of the pink lemonade mixture and stir gently with a rubber spatula, but do not fully combine the ingredients.

steps.headline: Scrape the ice cream into a freezer-proof container and freeze.
steps.description: Freeze the ice cream until solid, usually 4-6 hours or overnight.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Scoop the ice cream into serving bowls. Add whipped cream and drizzle lemon syrup over the ice cream, if desired. Enjoy!

text: Basic Lemonade Ice Cream Bring the milk to a boil. Once the milk has boiled, place a lid on the pot and set it aside. (Don’t let the milk cool to room temperature, though.) Combine the egg yolks and the sugar. Use a whisk or an electric mixer and beat them until the mixture is thick and fluffy. Gradually add the milk to the sugar mixture. Blend it together as you add it. Heat on the stove at a low temperature. Stir the cream with a spoon continuously to avoid burning; it should become a bit thicker and cover the spoon. Avoid boiling the mixture. This will result in curdling. Blend in the lemon extract, zest, and juice. Mix until fully combined and allow the cream to cool. Chill the cream. Once the combination has reached room temperature, cover it with plastic wrap and place it in the fridge. Use an ice cream maker to partly freeze the cream. If you don't have an ice cream maker, try using a bag - fill one bag with salt and ice, pour the cream into another bag and seal it, place the bagged cream into the bag of ice, seal the second bag, and shake it. Mix in the lemonade concentrate as the cream starts freezing. Blend thoroughly, then continue to freeze the ice cream. The ice cream will not fully freeze; this is normal. Put the ice cream in the freezer. Allow it to freeze until fully solid. Serve. Scoop the ice cream into serving bowls. Garnish with whipped cream and lemon syrup, if desired. Enjoy! 3-Ingredient Lemonade Ice Cream Beat the whipping cream, condensed milk, and lemonade concentrate in a large bowl. Blend with an electric mixer until fully combined. Add the food coloring, if desired. This will give it a more lemon-like final appearance. Add in the food coloring and blend until the mixture is one solid color, with no streaks. Freeze the cream. Pour the cream mixture into a container and freeze it for 4-5 hours, or until the ice cream is solid. Serve. Scoop the ice cream into serving bowls. Top with any desired toppings, such as whipped cream or sprinkles. Enjoy! Pink Lemonade Ice Cream Combine the pudding mix and milk into a bowl. Whisk well until the consistency is creamy and smooth. Chill the pudding in the fridge for five minutes. Leave the pudding in the fridge and remove once it sets. Fold half of the whipped topping into the pudding. Only add four ounces of the frozen whipped topping. Blend with an electric mixer on a low setting. Mix well until well combined and smooth. In a separate bowl, mix the remaining whipped topping with the pink lemonade packet. Stir well with a rubber spatula until fully incorporated. Add the pink lemonade mixture into the pudding mixture. Drop spoonfuls of the pink lemonade mixture and stir gently with a rubber spatula, but do not fully combine the ingredients. Scrape the ice cream into a freezer-proof container and freeze. Freeze the ice cream until solid, usually 4-6 hours or overnight. Serve. Scoop the ice cream into serving bowls. Add whipped cream and drizzle lemon syrup over the ice cream, if desired. Enjoy!
